subject: History
title: Hong Kong's Protest Movement
description: One-minute skill: Hong Kong's Protest Movement.

hook.text: In 2019, two million people in Hong Kong marched against Beijing's tightening grip. The world watched. China waited.

buildup.text: A proposed extradition law would let China try Hong Kong citizens in mainland courts. Millions said no.

discovery.text: Protesters used umbrellas, apps, and decentralized tactics. 'Be water'â€”Bruce Lee's mottoâ€”became their strategy.

twist.text: China imposed a national security law in 2020. Opposition leaders were arrested. Free press was shut down.

climax.text: Hong Kong's promised autonomy effectively ended 27 years early. Thousands emigrated. The movement was crushed.

punchline.text: Two million voices couldn't outshout one government.

quiz.question: What ended Hong Kong's 2019 protest movement?
options: Protesters negotiated a compromise with Beijing
China imposed a national security law and arrested opposition leaders
An economic crisis diverted public attention
